intro: Dalechampia clematifolia, commonly known as the trailing dalechampia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with unique floral structures. The plant is characterized by its trailing growth habit and pairs of opposite, ovate leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, often surrounded by colorful bracts. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or swampy areas.
